circumstances: The twin engine airplane departed Stanford Airport in the evening on a local pleasure flight. While flying at a relative low altitude, the pilot lost control of the airplane that crashed in flames in a prairie located in Utica, about 14 miles southeast of Stanford. The aircraft was totally destroyed and all eight occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
It was determined that the aircraft stalled due to an insufficient speed. The following factors were reported:
- The pilot failed to maintain flying speed, 
- Unwarranted low flying, 
- Physical impairment, 
- Alcoholic impairment of efficiency and judgment, 
- Buzzed tavern twice, 
- Pilot blood alcohol level 0,9‰.
